description: Anti-TNFα is a biologic drug used to treat inflammatory bowel disease.
Janus kinase inhibitors represent one of the modes of action for treating IBD.
Sphingosine-1-phosphate receptors are involved in the treatment strategies for IBD.
Cytokines are implicated in the immune response related to IBD and are targeted in therapies.
New therapeutic concepts aim to control previously less targeted immune cells, including B cells.
New therapies for IBD are expected to control innate lymphoid cells as part of the immune response.
